thread.title: CVE-2025-9006 | Tenda CH22 1.0.0.1 /goform/delFileName formdelFileName buffer overflow
thread.title_full: CVE-2025-9006 | Tenda CH22 1.0.0.1 /goform/delFileName formdelFileName buffer overflow

author: vuldb.com
title: CVE-2025-9006 | Tenda CH22 1.0.0.1 /goform/delFileName formdelFileName buffer overflow
text:
Summary
A vulnerability was found in Tenda CH22 1.0.0.1 and classified as critical. Affected by this issue is the function formdelFileName
of the file /goform/delFileName. The manipulation leads to buffer overflow.
This vulnerability is handled as CVE-2025-9006. The attack may be launched remotely. Furthermore, there is an exploit available.
Details
A vulnerability has been found in Tenda CH22 1.0.0.1 and classified as critical. Affected by this vulnerability is the function formdelFileName
of the file /goform/delFileName. The manipulation with an unknown input leads to a buffer overflow vulnerability. The CWE definition for the vulnerability is CWE-120. The product copies an input buffer to an output buffer without verifying that the size of the input buffer is less than the size of the output buffer, leading to a buffer overflow. As an impact it is known to affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability.
It is possible to read the advisory at github.com. This vulnerability is known as CVE-2025-9006. The exploitation appears to be easy. The attack can be launched remotely. Technical details and also a public exploit are known.
It is possible to download the exploit at github.com. It is declared as proof-of-concept.
There is no information about possible countermeasures known. It may be suggested to replace the affected object with an alternative product.
Similar entry is available at VDB-215138.
